title: An Open-label Study to Assess Brain Uptake and Safety of AH110690 (18F) Injection in Subjects With Probable Alzheimer's Disease, Amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairment and Healthy Volunteers
description_brief: Study to Assess Brain Uptake and Safety of AH110690 (18F) Injection in Subjects with Probable Alzheimer's Disease, Amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairment and Healthy Volunteers.
explanation_target: Reason: The investigational product AH110690 (18F) is a radiolabeled PET tracer (18F‑flutemetamol) used to image fibrillar amyloid-β in the brain and the study title/description state it is assessing brain uptake and safety — i.e., a diagnostic imaging study rather than a therapeutic intervention. citeturn0search0turn0search5turn0search7

Act (web search / evidence): Literature and trial registry entries identify AH110690 as the drug substance in 18F‑flutemetamol, a fluorine‑18 labeled derivative of Pittsburgh Compound B developed as an amyloid PET radiotracer; clinical studies and registries list AH110690 as an alias and describe its use for diagnostic imaging of amyloid plaques. citeturn0search0turn0search7turn0search5

Reflect: Because the trial assesses brain uptake and safety of a radiotracer (diagnostic PET agent) rather than delivering a biologic or small‑molecule therapy intended to modify disease, improve cognition, or treat neuropsychiatric symptoms, the correct classification is 'N/A' (diagnostic imaging study). No placebo or therapeutic mechanism is applicable. citeturn0search0turn0search7
